page.title: 13Dolau School
page.content: Dolau school was opened in 1928. The children on the south side of the main Railway line came to Dolau and the children on the north side of the railway line went to Llanharan school. Dolau school was used as an{ {"all-through"}school-you came when you were 4 and left when you were 14. Now, Dolau is a primary school. It became a primary school at the beginning of September term 1960, at the same time as Llanharry school became a secondaryschool. In 1970 Dolau became a bilingual school. The present headmaster Mr.Williams came to Dolau school in 1965. The school swimming pool came into use in 1972. There are 127 pupils on the English side, and 178 on the Welsh side. Dolau was one of the first{bilingual}schools in the area and children travelled here from all over Glamorgan.
